Heapsort

Build a heap, repeatedly extract the maximum

Build a pile where the biggest item is always on top. Keep removing the top item (the biggest) and rebuilding the pile.

How It Works

  1. Build a max-heap from the array
  2. Swap root (maximum) with last element
  3. Reduce heap size by 1
  4. Heapify the root
  5. Repeat until heap is empty

Complexity

  • Time Best: O(n log n)
  • Time Avg: O(n log n)
  • Time Worst: O(n log n)
  • Space: O(1) - in-place

When to Use

  • Guaranteed O(n log n) with O(1) space
  • Priority queue operations needed too

Dijkstra's Algorithm

Always expand the closest unvisited vertex

Finding the fastest route on a map by always exploring the closest city you haven't visited yet.

How It Works

  1. Set distance to source = 0, all others = âˆž
  2. Add all vertices to priority queue
  3. While queue not empty:
  4. - Extract vertex with minimum distance
  5. - For each neighbor, if path through current is shorter, update

Complexity

  • Time: O((V + E) log V) with binary heap
  • Space: O(V)

When to Use

  • Shortest paths with non-negative weights
  • GPS navigation
  • Network routing
